newsitem.title: USA: Duke shuts Oconee 2 S.C. power plant.
newsitem.headline: Duke shuts Oconee 2 S.C. power plant.

text.p: Duke Power Co shut its 846 megawatt (MW) Oconee 2 nuclear power plant in Seneca, S.C., over the weekend to repair a leaking valve, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Monday.
The NRC report said the unit, being kept on hot standby, was expected to begin restart operations later today.
The adjacent Oconee units 1 and 3, also rated at 846 ME each, are operating at full power, the NRC said.
Duke is the operator and sole owner of all three Oconee units.
